model.effective_equation: Nonrelativistic s-wave Schrödinger equation for relative motion with an effective potential V(r)=μ φ(r)=-μ c^2 u(r).

singlet: a_s (np low-energy; fits V1_s,V2_s>=0; barrier+tail split fixed by λπ)
r_s (np low-energy; fits V1_s,V2_s>=0; barrier+tail split fixed by λπ)

positioning: Phenomenological constraint (effective model), not a first-principles derivation of nuclear forces.
The ansatz class is intentionally low-parameter to avoid 'arbitrary function fit'.
To limit arbitrariness, keep (R1,R2) fixed from step 7.9.6 and add only (Rc,Vc) as sign-structure; singlet fits (V1_s,V2_s) by (a_s,r_s) and v2s is the differential prediction.

sources.dataset: NIST Cuu CODATA constants (mp,mn,md) for deuteron binding baseline

tail_constraint.barrier_tail_rule: Vb = barrier_height_factor*V3_mean, Vt = tail_depth_factor*V3_mean (no mean-preserving constraint)

fit_triplet.note: Triplet: λπ-constrained geometry + barrier+tail split beyond R2 (free tail depth); extended (k,q)-scan with dual-envelope criteria (triplet v2t + singlet v2s), then fit per dataset.

fit_singlet.fit_mode: Shared geometry (R1,R2,R3=R2+λπ) + barrier+tail split; fit (V1_s,V2_s>=0) to match (a_s,r_s).
fit_singlet.note_fit: bisection did not converge; using best endpoint (barrier+tail)
fit_singlet.note: Singlet: uses shared (R1,R2) and a fixed barrier+tail split beyond R2; fits (V1_s,V2_s) by (a_s,r_s). v2s is a prediction.

tail_constraint.barrier_tail_rule: Vb = barrier_height_factor*V3_mean, Vt = tail_depth_factor*V3_mean (no mean-preserving constraint)

fit_triplet.note: Triplet: λπ-constrained geometry + barrier+tail split beyond R2 (free tail depth); extended (k,q)-scan with dual-envelope criteria (triplet v2t + singlet v2s), then fit per dataset.

fit_singlet.fit_mode: Shared geometry (R1,R2,R3=R2+λπ) + barrier+tail split; fit (V1_s,V2_s>=0) to match (a_s,r_s).
fit_singlet.note_fit: bisection did not converge; using best endpoint (barrier+tail)
fit_singlet.note: Singlet: uses shared (R1,R2) and a fixed barrier+tail split beyond R2; fits (V1_s,V2_s) by (a_s,r_s). v2s is a prediction.

notes: Eq.(18) and Eq.(19) are two phase-shift analyses in the same primary source; their difference is treated as an analysis-dependent systematics proxy.
Triplet fit is performed per dataset to expose sensitivity of the inferred u-profile to that proxy.
In step 7.9.7/7.9.8/7.13.3/7.13.4/7.13.5/7.13.6/7.13.7/7.13.8, singlet r_s is fitted per dataset; v2s is the remaining differential prediction.

acceptance_criteria: Under the λπ-constrained three-range (barrier+tail split; free tail depth) ansatz class with a single global (k,q) selected by cross-systematics, after fitting triplet targets and fitting singlet (a_s,r_s) with V2_s>=0, both the resulting triplet v2t and the predicted singlet v2s should be compatible with the observed ranges (eq18–eq19).
If either the resulting triplet v2t or the predicted singlet v2s falls outside the analysis-dependent envelope, the ansatz class is rejected as a representation of the nuclear-scale u-profile.

policy.selection_rule: Prefer any (k,q) that makes triplet v2t and singlet (r_s,v2s) all within envelope; tie-break by minimal max_dist_total(v2), then max_dist(r_s), then k, then q.
